snippet: Rising oil prices and demand for foreign-made cars, computers and food products led to January’s sharp rise.
abstract: Commerce Department reports that the US trade deficit surged to $52.6 billion in January, the widest imbalance in more than three years, after rising oil prices and demand for foreign-made cars drove imports to a record high; imports rose 2.1 percent to a record $233.4 billion. Exports were up a smaller 1.4 percent to $180.8 billion.
lead_paragraph: Rising oil prices and demand for foreign-made cars, computers and food products led to January’s sharp rise.

headline.seo: U.S. Trade Deficit Surges to a Three-Year High
headline.main: U.S. Trade Deficit Surged to 3-Year High in January
headline.print_headline: U.S. Trade Deficit Surged To 3-Year High in January
